intro: Saussurea pinnatiphylla, commonly known as the Tibetan yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and other mountainous regions in Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Tibetan medicine. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in high-altitude flora.
